TopicTitle: Which moon is the most interesting by its looks and scenery?

Articles.Content: I have my interplanetary spacecraft loaded with several nuke engines in the orbit around jool, but i have enough dv to land on one moon only. I cant decide.
i love pol. the little pollen hill mound thingys are very unique
If you have enough dv to land on tylo, you could probably visit both Pol and Bop.
Lathe's atmosphere makes everything look so good.
The 2 farthest moons are a pain to land on if your dV tight as their highly eccentric. I'd actually go for Vall as you could return and you could look at the awesome monolith near its south pole .
I really like Pol, but I had to go with Vall. That nifty frozen surface is just very cool.
I hear Ike is awesome this time of year.
I'd say Laythe simply for its atmosphere and liquid ocean.

Definitely Pol.

Seriously, there's nothing quite like it anywhere else in the game. With terrain scatter on especially, it's fascinating.

Edited April 16, 2014 by SkyRender
I'd say Val slightly edges out Layethe.

Definitely Pol.

http://www.skyrender.net/lp2/ksp/ik80.jpg

Seriously, there's nothing quite like it anywhere else in the game. With terrain scatter on especially, it's fascinating.

The only time I've ever landed on Pol, I left my ship in orbit and jetpacked down to the surface.
Vall is a beauty.

Vall, Vall, the answer to this question is always Vall.

(Yeah, second time I've posted that today. Sorry.)

Mun ;P

oaifbei aeiebn
Where is Gilly?

Where is Gilly?

About 10 billion miles away from his spaceship.
I had to go with laythe especially after exploring it with a plane.

Yeah, sure, Laythe is beautiful, and Vall is pretty, but Pol...

Pol is awesome. It's my favourite moon so far. The colours and the terrain are so incredibly unique, and the low gravity... just, just Pol. No questions asked. Pol.
Seems like a waste to fly all the way out there just to visit an oversized pollen grain. I'd go to Vall.
I know it's weird given that Laythe has an actual atmosphere and oceans, but Vall always seemed the most interesting to me.
I'd say pol the color,ground and the huge slopes make it very intresting.
I don't know, Pol just seems a bit too over-the-top for me to enjoy its scenery. Vall takes my vote. (I've always liked the color blue, anyway. )
Really guys? Not a single Minmus? I mean, c'mon, yes it's close to Kerbin, but who doesn't like mint?
None of the above. Minmus is the most interesting.
Laythe is cool to fly around but all the sandbar islands are kinda boring. Pol feels more alien and interesting to me. Vall is awesome too. Love the south polar region with the ice steppes.
